data.title: Who are the members of Fall Out Boy? Here’s everything you need to know about them
data.meta_description: Fall Out Boy is a two-time Grammy-nominated four-member rock band; Pete Wentz, Joe Trohman, Patrick Stump and Andy Hurley. The band was formed in 2001 in
data.text:
Fall Out Boy is a two-time Grammy-nominated four-member rock band; Pete Wentz, Joe Trohman, Patrick Stump and Andy Hurley. The band was formed in 2001 in a Chicago, Illinois suburb known as Wilmette. In 2003, they released their debut album titled Take This To Your Grave which gained them huge underground success. Their second body of work, From Under the Cork, released in 2015, sold over two million copies and earned them a Best New Artist nomination at the 2006 Grammy Awards.

The band then followed up their second album with another corpus titled: Infinity on High, released in 2007. The album debuted at number 1 on the Billboard 200 to become the band’s debut album. They have since released four more albums Folie à Deux (2008), Save Rock and Roll (2013), American Beauty/American Psycho (2015), and La mania (2018). The last three albums came after the band members chose to go on hiatus indefinitely to work together and focus on other projects. Read on to learn more about the band members, their backgrounds, and other accomplishments outside of the band.

Who are the members of Fall Out Boy? Here’s everything you need to know about them

Pete Wentz

Pete Wentz was born Peter Lewis Kingston WentzIII to Dale (née Lewis) and Pete Wentz II on June 5, 1979 in Chicago, Illinois. Her father worked as a lawyer while her mother was a high school admissions counselor. He is of German, English and Afro-Jamaican descent.

Unlike the other members of Fall Out Boy, Wentz was raised in a well to make family. He attended New Trier High School and North Shore Country Day, where he participated extensively in football and was drafted in the sport. After graduating from high school, he enrolled at DePaul University where he studied political science. Wentz was about to graduate from school when he chose to drop out and focus on his musical career with Fall Out Boy. However, before getting into music, he had considered becoming a professional football player as he excelled in the sport, but according to him, the sport was not challenging enough. So he chose the music.

Prior to forming rock band Fall Out Boy, PeteWentz was well known in Chicago’s hardcore punk music scene. He was a member of bands such as First Born, Birthright, Racetraitor, Extinction, Arma Angelus and Yellow Road Priest. In 2001, after becoming frustrated with the type of music created by the bands he was a member of, he and Arma Angelus bassist Joe Trohman decided to create Fall Out Boy. The band enjoyed huge success before going on an indefinite hiatus in 2009. During the hiatus, Wentz joined forces with singer Bebe Rexha to form the band Black Cards. Black Cards released a single and planned to release a mixtape before Rexha decided to leave the band to explore other opportunities. Wentz continued with the group,

Apart from his musical pursuits, Pete Wentz has ventured into many other things. He has been on many TV shows and also owns a film production company called Bartskull Films. Wentz also owns the DCD2 Records label, which features bands like Panic! to the nightclub and class gymnasium of the heroes on his list. He is also co-owner of clothing company Clandestine Industries, nightclub Angels & Kings, and professional football team Phoenix Rising FC.

As for his personal life, Wentz was previously married to singer and actress Ashlee Simpson. They married on May 17, 2008 at Simpson’s parents’ residence in Encino, California. In November of the same year, they welcomed their son, Bronx Mowgli Wentz. The couple’s marriage lasted until February 2011, when Simpson filed for divorce. Wentz has since had a relationship with Meagan Camper which bore him two more children. a son named Saint Lazslo Wentz, born August 2014, and a daughter named Marvel Jane Wentz, born May 13, 2018.

Joe Trohman

Joe Trohman’s journey to becoming a musician began as a teenager when he learned to play the guitar at the age of 15. He was born on September 1, 1984 in Hollywood, Broward County, Florida, but grew up in South Russell., Ohio. His family later moved to the Chicago area where he was able to forge a musical career by co-founding Fall Out Boy.

Trohman, who serves as Fall Out Boy’s vocalist and lead guitarist, co-founded the band in 2001 after serving as bassist for metalcore band Arma Angelus, a band whose fellow Fall Out Boy co-founder Pete Wentz served as lead vocalist. . Trohman and Wentz had known each other since they were young when they attended the same high school – New Trier High School in Winnetka, Illinois. The pair decided to start the band after sharing their thoughts, as Trohman was supposedly looking for a band that could produce more melodic music, while Wentz was also looking to start a new band to serve as a project.” of escape”.

Fall Out Boy went on to be hugely successful in the following decade, topping the US charts and selling millions of records. In 2009, after the band decided to go on an indefinite hiatus, Trohman and fellow bandmate Andy Hurley decided to team up with a few other artists from bands such as Anthrax, Volbeat and Every Time I Die to form a heavy metal. great band called The Damned Things. The band performed concerts in the United States and United Kingdom in early and mid-2010 before signing a contract with Island Records and releasing their debut album in December 2010, titled Ironiclast.

Joe Trohman is known for his collection of guitars. Since 2011, he has been married to Marie Wortman Goble, with whom he has two daughters.

patrick stump

Patrick Stump is the lead vocalist, rhythm guitarist and primary songwriter of Fall Out Boy. He joined the band in 2001 when he was the drummer for grindcore band Xgrinding processX. Fall Out Boy co-founders Pete Wentz and Joe Trohman were looking for a drummer to join the band, whom Stump was able to audition. Along the way, however, Trohman noticed Stump’s acoustic guitar singing and singing abilities, with which he managed to impress the duo and become a member in that capacity. He and Trohman have since switched between lead and rhythm guitar roles during recording sessions and gigs.

Stump, who was born Patrick Martin Stumph, on April 27, 1984, in Evanston, Illinois, the youngest of three children born to Patricia (née Vaughn) and David Stumph was inspired by his father, himself a folksinger. In 2003, following numerous pronunciation errors, Stump opted to drop the letter “h” from his name to facilitate cross-references. He played a pivotal role in the success of Fall Out Boy in the 2000s before deciding to work on a solo project in 2010 as the entire band decided to go on an indefinite hiatus.

He then wrote, produced and performed all the songs on his debut album. Soul punk which was released in October 2011. Stump has since worked with many other artists, mostly as a producer, and also has an acting career in film, appearing in episodes of shows such as ‘House’ , “Law & Order” and “90210”. In 2012, he married longtime girlfriend Elisa Yao, with whom he shares a home in Chicago with their son, Declan.

Andy Hurley

Andy Hurley is the fourth member of Fall OutA rock band who serves as their drummer. He joined the band as a full-time member in 2013 after working with the band part-time. Hurley has been a friend of Fall Out Boy founding member Wentz since he was 16. Before joining forces in Fall Out Boy, they were both in three other bands, Hurley having been in more than half a dozen bands himself.

Hurley was born Andrew John Hurley on December 31, 1980, in Menomonee Falls, Wisconsin. After the death of his father at the age of 5, he was raised only by his mother, who worked as a nurse. He fell in love with music in middle school while playing the saxophone. While attending Menomonee Falls High School, he switched to school to learn to play the drums and became very good at it. A student at the University of Wisconsin–Milwaukee with a double major in anthropology and history, Hurley was highly prized for his drumming skills, earning him membership in three bands at the time. However, he had limited success until he joined Fall Out Boy.

In his personal life, Andy Hurley maintainsway of life, that is, he refrains from alcohol, tobacco and other recreational drugs, as well as reckless sex. He also maintains a vegan diet.
